actionUnits.condition: MonoBehaviour WinLose (m_Script guid=d8624f87f98aa484bb7925103f5d458e) attached to GameCondition. Scene settings: restartdelay=2; PrefabInstance modifications indicate WinUI -> fileID 109963297 and LoseUI -> fileID 109963299 (these may appear as 0 in the flattened MonoBehaviour block but are set via PrefabInstance). Expectation: Winlevel() activates WinUI, loselevel() activates LoseUI. Note: GameCondition has no Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger; direct method invocation is required to test coverage.

Simulate OnTriggerEnter for AttachToElevator (MonoBehaviour id 764083142, script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77). Preconditions required for this to work: (1) BoxCollider id 764083144 must be set to IsTrigger = true OR test framework must simulate a trigger overlap; (2) Assign the script's 'player' reference to this same GameObject (platform2 (1) GameObject fileID 764083141), because the script checks 'if (gameObject == player)'; (3) Ensure a valid opposing Collider enters to generate the trigger event. Expected behavior: player.transform.SetParent(platform2 (1).transform, true).

Simulate OnTriggerExit for AttachToElevator (MonoBehaviour id 764083142, script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77). Use the same setup as the OnTriggerEnter step: BoxCollider id 764083144 acts as a trigger (or simulation), and the script's 'player' is assigned to this GameObject (fileID 764083141). An opposing Collider must exit to generate the event. Expected behavior: player.transform.parent = null.

Exercise AttachToElevator (MonoBehaviour id: 2013310826; script guid: 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77) OnTriggerEnter and OnTriggerExit on 'platform2 (2)'. Current scene config: BoxCollider id 2013310828 with m_IsTrigger=0; Has_Rigidbody=False; MonoBehaviour.player=null. Note: For OnTriggerEnter/Exit to fire in Unity 3D physics, one collider must be marked IsTrigger and at least one of the two interacting objects must have a Rigidbody. Also the script compares 'gameObject == player', which only becomes true if the platform object itself is assigned to 'player' (currently null). With current config, even if triggers fire, the if-branch will not execute any parenting logic. This Trigger action attempts to enter and then exit the collider volume to cover OnTriggerEnter and OnTriggerExit message handlers.

Simulate OnTriggerEnter on GameObject 'platform2 (3)' (PrefabInstance fileID 666190384) to exercise AttachToElevator.OnTriggerEnter (MonoBehaviour id 666190386, script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77, serialized field 'player' currently null). Note: BoxCollider id 666190388 has m_IsTrigger=0, so this manual Trigger simulates the enter event; with player == null, the condition (gameObject == player) evaluates false and no parenting occurs.

Simulate OnTriggerExit on GameObject 'platform2 (3)' (PrefabInstance fileID 666190384) to exercise AttachToElevator.OnTriggerExit (MonoBehaviour id 666190386, script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77). With BoxCollider id 666190388 m_IsTrigger=0 this is a manual simulation; with 'player' null, the condition (gameObject == player) evaluates false and no unparenting occurs.

Simulate OnTriggerEnter for AttachToElevator (MonoBehaviour id 397541585, script GUID 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77) by causing an overlapping entry with another object that has a Rigidbody and a Trigger collider (e.g., the Player). Note: platform2 has a BoxCollider (id 397541586) with m_IsTrigger=0 and no Rigidbody; at least one of the colliders must be a trigger and one involved object must have a Rigidbody for trigger callbacks. The serialized field 'player' is currently null, so the if(gameObject == player) check will be false and no parenting will occur; this covers the false branch of OnTriggerEnter.

Simulate OnTriggerExit by moving the same Rigidbody+Trigger collider object out of overlap with platform2 to invoke AttachToElevator.OnTriggerExit (MonoBehaviour id 397541585). With 'player' still null, the if(gameObject == player) check will be false; no unparenting occurs; this covers the false branch of OnTriggerExit.

Positive-branch coverage for OnTriggerEnter: Preconfigure the scene so AttachToElevator.player references platform2's GameObject (fileID 397541582). Then simulate an overlap entry (as in step 1). Expect player.transform.SetParent(gameObject.transform, true) to execute (self-parenting) when OnTriggerEnter fires.

Positive-branch coverage for OnTriggerExit: With AttachToElevator.player still set to platform2's GameObject (fileID 397541582), simulate overlap exit. Expect player.transform.parent = null to execute when OnTriggerExit fires.

MonoBehaviour (guid f7de224e5fee443418417f9f2bfa2998) is the Scoremanager script attached to the 'ScoreManager' GameObject. In this Level4 scene instance (PrefabInstance overrides), fields are assigned as: ScoreText(fileID=109963300), AmountUI(fileID=109963301), Timer(fileID=109963298), StarValue=1, winAmount=6, winlosescript(component fileID=1943288799). To cover the branch in Scoremanager.changescore that calls winlosescript.Winlevel() when score == winAmount, we will directly invoke WinLose.Winlevel() on the referenced component because changescore(int) is not a parameterless callable event and no collider/EventTrigger is present on ScoreManager in the provided scene data.

Validate automatic behaviors of Scoremanager: Start() sets AmountUI.text to 'Star Amount: 6' (per PrefabInstance winAmount override), and Update() continuously updates Timer.text = Time.time.ToString('0.0'). This action passively waits to allow Update() to execute and Timer UI to change.
